cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi SE of Charleston, South Carolina / 450 mi S of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, forecast to bend NNW–N and make landfall along the southeast North Carolina coast before tracking inland up the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: vicinity of Cape Fear – Surf City, NC (near Wilmington)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Surf City, NC to Chincoteague, VA, including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cape Fear, NC to Fenwick Island, DE, including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast North Carolina through the Mid-Atlantic coastline
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible Friday night–early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible, especially near high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated higher amounts; localized flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents; minor coastal flooding during high-tide cycles
